title: Waterville Valley to host World Cup moguls competition after venue change from Deer Valley
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Skiing "Insufficient snowpack and persistently warm temperatures" at Deer Valley forced a late change to the New Hampshire ski area.
Lower Bobby's Run at Waterville Valley Resort in New Hampshire as the site of the U.
S.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The injuries Kelsey Fitzsimmons suffered during the incident have now healed enough that she can use an alcohol breath test safely.
North Andover Police Officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons during her arraignment in August.

Ben Pennington/for the Boston Globe Kelsey Fitzsimmons, the North Andover police officer who was shot by a colleague after allegedly pointing a gun at him during a confrontation in June, was released from custody Tuesday.

title: 2 dead in multi-vehicle crash in Watertown
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Local News An investigation into the crash remains ongoing by the Watertown Police Department and Massachusetts State Police.
Two people died in a multi-vehicle crash Tuesday afternoon in Watertown, according to police.
Watertown police and firefighters responded to the scene on Bigelow Avenue around noon.

title: ‘It just seems like a Mike Vrabel-type team’: Kurt Warner credits Patriots for taking on coach’s personality
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "You're going to have to go in and you're going to have to outplay them across the board to beat that football team.
Because if you don't, they're going to take advantage of it.
" Craig Woodson celebrates recovering a fumble in the Patriots' win over the Ravens.

title: Readers: Have you ever been a third wheel?
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Share your experiences being single next to a couple or group of couples.
Getty Images Signature You’re reading Meredith Goldstein’s Love Letters newsletter.
Each week, Meredith shares tales of human connection, thoughts on public policy and relationships, and behind-the-scenes stories about the Love Letters column and podcast.

title: 10 towns remain defiant of MBTA Communities Act as year-end deadline looms
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News The clock is ticking for these communities as they weigh the consequences of standing firm against the law.
A water tower is seen in the Point Shirley neighborhood of Winthrop, Massachusetts October 29, 2025.
The town is fighting against a state housing law that would bring more development to town which has dredged up broader fears about economic and social change.

title: Ahead of a self-described ‘must-win’ game, Bruins fail to meet the moment
author: Conor Ryan

title: Hit-and-run crash kills cyclist in Fall River, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News The driver of a green Subaru Legacy fled the scene after fatally injuring a cyclist in Fall River, the Bristol County District Attorney said.
A 34-year-old man was killed in a hit-and-run crash in Fall River on Sunday, the local prosecutor said.
Fall River police received a call for a bicyclist who had been hit by a vehicle just after 5 p.

title: Video: Bruins’ Nikita Zadorov dresses as Santa Claus ahead of holiday game vs. Montreal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Zadorov was one of several Bruins to don some festive attire ahead of Tuesday's game against the Habs.
Nikita Zadorov was in a festive mood ahead of Tuesday's game against Montreal.
AP Photo/Charles Krupa Nikita Zadorov is at his best when he’s doling out punishment on the ice on behalf of the Boston Bruins.
